intro: Rosa roxburghii f. normalis, commonly known as the Chinese rose or Rosa chinensis, is a shrub native to China and widely cultivated for its ornamental value. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant, pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and is known for its strong, pleasant aroma. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. This variety is also valued for its use in traditional Chinese medicine and as a source of rose oil.
